title: The Circle's Jack and Beth confirm romance and are absolutely smitten
text:
Beth and Jack have confirmed they’re going to continue dating outside the show (Picture: Channel 4)

Jack and Beth have revealed that they’re going to give their romance a shot after leaving their time on The Circle.

The pair were strangers when they were paired up on the Channel 4 show, being given a second shot at the popularity contest by playing 62-year-old Joyce.

But it didn’t take long for the sparks to fly between cheeky chappy Jack and Beth, and on their final night in the house, they were seen sharing the first ever snog of the show.

After being eliminated from the game tonight by Woody, the pair exclusively revealed to Metro.co.uk that they’re up for seeing each other properly.

‘That’s funny – that was actually our first kiss,’ Jack told us. ‘I wasn’t sure if they were going to catch it, I thought, “do you know what? I’ve been in here for a week with her now, and I just need to kiss her”.’

‘I wasn’t sure how reciprocated it was, but I hoped it was, and so I just needed to kiss her,’ he added. ‘I thought, as I went to kiss her, as it was a doorway they might not have seen, but nope! There’s cameras everywhere!’

‘I think we’re both really happy with how it turned out,’ Jack continued. ‘I wouldn’t have liked to have had that experience with anyone else. It wouldn’t have been the same.’

Jack and Beth have got close catfishing together as Joyce (Picture: Channel 4)

Beth was clearly in agreement, and said: ‘I’ve said it loads of times, it wouldn’t have been the same without Jack, I wouldn’t have wanted to do it with anyone else, and he’s pretty much made my experience on The Circle what it was.’

Jack then revealed: ‘You have agreed to go on a date with me, so…we’ll see where it goes from there, but I’m taking that as a good sign!’

‘I agreed to that before we’d even had a kiss!’ she laughed.

‘Yeah, you did! God things have moved in a weird order.’

Considering they moved in together before they even really knew each other, we can’t say we disagree there.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Despite being locked up together in a flat with little alone time, the pair both admitted to us that they were actually happy with it that way.

Beth admitted that it might have actually worked in their favour, and told us: ‘We obviously started as friends and we’re just seeing how it goes, but ultimately, we know each other so well after just a week of living together.

‘We know each other’s quirks, we know when Jack’s going into a little huff because he’s hungry or you need a bit of space. You just get to know each other so quick that in real life it’ll just be a lot easier.

‘You face a lot in there and it’s an intense pressurised environment so if we can be good in there we can be great out here.’

The couple have even shared cosy mornings in bed together over the past couple of days (Picture: Channel 4)

‘I fancied you for the personality and before I knew you were you,’ Jack continued. ‘So I don’t think there’s many situations in the world where you get to know each other as a friend, then start to really connect with them so much you fancy them, and then to see them and go “jeez this girl is stunning!”

‘It was a really nice order of things.’

‘It made us a lot more sincere for me,’ Beth agreed. ‘Knowing that when we were flirting there was a spark there and knowing that it was how we connected over a chat, rather than physical because we hadn’t met.’

Awwww you guys!

Who knew playing a 62-year-old woman with a love of gin and lust for life could be so romantic?

The Circle continues weeknights and Sundays at 10pm on Channel 4.

description: Jack and Beth, aka Joyce, were blocked from The Circle after living together for a week, but after a cheeky snog, it seems romance is blooming.
